feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays, which are subtracted from the total working days to determine the actual working days used in the formula. Once an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates a pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.
Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave requests and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction calculations
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

Access the Daily Wage Calculator by navigating to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection
Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation to access salary proration configuration

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on payroll.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays when using working days calculation base
Super admin role with access to payroll settings is required to configure leave encashment policies.
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
Super admin role required to access and modify salary proration settings

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowances), number of working days or calendar days in the month based on the leave policy, and the number of public holidays falling in the month.
Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and salary components to include (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only)
Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request that is reflected on the payroll table, and the calculated daily pay rate used for the deduction.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days to arrive at actual working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select a calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to factor into the calculations

1. Access Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select applicable salary components for leave encashment (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select the required calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by Number of Actual Working Days. The leave policy determines whether calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days) are used. Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to calculate actual working days used in the formula.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law); the selected calculation base directly impacts salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts

Salary component selection is limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method options are Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Super admins can configure specific leave types for end-of-service calculations.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins have flexibility to choose from multiple calculation and day type options

Changes to salary proration affect all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions have been submitted for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must reject those transactions before saving new salary proration settings

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, the daily pay calculation must be based on 20 days, not 22 days.

Calendar days calculation varies by month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage calculations; different calculation methods can produce significantly different wage amounts
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten when configuring leave encashment settings.
Multiple options are available for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on organizational payroll policy
When payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator integrates with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management systems to receive approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems to access salary information.
The Daily Wage Calculator impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction; it interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings
The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies.
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; related to leave encashment configuration
Interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Leave policy: The organizational rule determining whether leave is calculated based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days).

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: flexible calculation base set by payroll managers according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: Calculations performed when an employee exits the organization. Daily Wage Calculator: A tool for configuring leave encashment policies based on salary components and calculation methods.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily wage rather than monthly salary; Basic Only: Calculation method using only base salary; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and additional allowances; Calendar days: Day calculation type counting all days including weekends; Working days: Day calculation type counting only business days; Custom days: Day calculation type with user-defined day counting logic

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): The payroll feature for configuring salary proration. Salary Proration: The proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Custom days, calendar days, or working days—the three methods for determining prorated salary amounts
